Query Management¶

ramascene.querymanagement.clean_indicators(idx_lst)¶

Clean indicator data to make it ready for calculations

ramascene.querymanagement.clean_local_leafs(a_list)¶

Clean the country or product data for calculations by splitting and converting to integers

ramascene.querymanagement.clean_single_leafs(leaf, OFFSET)¶

Clean the country or product data for calculations by converting to integers

ramascene.querymanagement.convert_to_numpy(products, countries, indicators)¶

Convert lists to numpy array

ramascene.querymanagement.get_aggregations_countries(querySelection, result_data)¶

Invoked at Celery Task. Returns key/value pair country with key name corresponding to querySelection global_id. This function aggregates result data that came from calculation process (calcOne) (summing is performed only if needed)

ramascene.querymanagement.get_aggregations_products(querySelection, result_data)¶

Invoked at Celery Task. Returns key/value pair country with key name corresponding to querySelection global_id. This function aggregates result data that came from calculation process (calcOne) (summing is performed only if needed)

ramascene.querymanagement.get_calc_names_country(country_result_data)¶

Returns key/value pair country with key as name corresponding to querySelection global_id expects arguments key/value pair product with key as global_id

ramascene.querymanagement.get_calc_names_product(prod_result_data)¶

Returns key/value pair product with key as name corresponding to querySelection global_id expects arguments key/value pair product with key as global_id

ramascene.querymanagement.get_leafs(product_global_ids, country_global_ids)¶

Returns the leaf nodes of a given global id in a format ready for calculation

ramascene.querymanagement.get_names(prod_ids, country_ids, indicator_ids)¶

Returns from a list of global_ids the corresponding names expects lists of global_ids

ramascene.querymanagement.identify_country(country_id)¶

Helper function. Returns model identifier (check if it represent aggregations or not)

ramascene.querymanagement.identify_product(prod_id)¶

Helper function. Returns model identifier (check if it represent aggregations or not)
